Dialogue_Line: That would be me.
My brother, Johnny.
Little sis.
Me!  Ain't I gorgeous?
But what would I say?
I could talk to myself all day -- but would you want to listen?
Let's get the firewood and get back.
I want to finish my story.
Let's get the firewood so I can make fun of her story some more.
Nice try.
Not here.
Sure, just step into my hands.
I swear you're lighter than when we were kids.
Damn it, I'm just not strong enough for this move.  That was a great idea, though.
He's my brother!
Sure, I can give you a boost.
Ew.
Huh, that was easier than I expected.
I can see the clearing from here.  Looks normal.
It's the same as when we arrived.
It's a paint-by-number.
That's funny: blue is 1, orange is 2, yellow is 3 - why would green be 18?
Don't mind if I do.
Haha, the all-powerful wizard hung a paint-by-number in his bedroom?
The numbers aren't even in order.  Blue, orange, yellow, then it skips to 18 for green.
Sure, why not.
It's covered in dust.  And no footprints or sign of human activity, which is a relief.
Yowzers, it's musty and dirty in here.  I think I even see cobwebs on the ceiling.
Much as I'd like to pretend I'm a spy or something, I'm not sure what I could do.
I wouldn't want to get my hands so gross and dusty.
Nicely made.
Real solid sheets. Yoink!
A bedsheet that we stole off the wizard's bed.
Bedsheets from the bedroom of the creepy house.
Nicer than the ones we've got back home.
These are probably a billion threads or something.
This should work - I can hold on to this and Sarah can help Lindsay up.
